schema.title: Auction

items.description: A module in the Andromeda Protocol is a component that can be attached to an ADO, enhancing its functionality by adding specific features or capabilities, like managing rates or keeping a list of addresses.

address.description: An address within the Andromeda ecosystem can be either a straightforward, readable address like cosmos1... or a specialized Andromeda Virtual File System (VFS) path such as /home/user/app/component. VFS paths can be local, like ./component, or include protocols for interacting across different blockchain networks, typically formatted as <protocol>://<chain>/<path> or ibc://cosmoshub-4/user/app/component for cross-chain communication.

schema.description: The Auction ADO enables users to auction off items.

ui:options.title: Selected Modules
ui:options.description: (Optional) Add attachable Andromeda ADO Modules to the contract. Currently compatible: 'rates', 'address-list', and 'receipt'

ui:options.title: Identifier
ui:options.description: Can be either an address or app component name of a specific ADO within an app

ui:options.title: Module Type
ui:options.description: The name of the module to add. Can be set one of the following: "rates", "address-list", and "receipt".

ui:options.title: Is the Module Able to be Modified?
ui:options.description: If the field is checked then the module is allowed to be modified.
